Posts.EditableText: So, I recently downloaded Quest, and I'm trying out the Gamebook function, because it seems easier than building a text adventure at this point. This Gamebook is already at 50+ pages long, and I don't want people who play it to have to go through the exact same choices they did before to get through this game should it crash/they close it, so I'm wondering: is there any way to save the game in Gamebook?

Posts.EditableText:
In the desktop editor (what you downloaded), you can save the game at runtime by going to the File menu and hitting Save. (If you're editing the game, it saves your source. If you're playing the game, it saves the state of your game. Be sure you don't confuse the two! People have accidentally overwritten their source with a save game.) 

If you upload your game to the Quest website, it will have a "Save" button in the top right corner.

(Strangely, if you actually *create* a game with the Quest website editor, there is no Save button when you run...)
